page.title: 03Lydiard Millicent Today
page.content: The village has grown in size greatly in the last 25 years due mainly to the 2 large housing estates built for people working in Swindon.{The Beeches built between 1959-61 to the west of the village consists of 30 houses and bungalows but{Chestnut Springs}to the east, some 120 houses, is still expanding at the present time so that it has become far too large for the village. There is a{village hall}where Cubs, Brownies, Guides and the Red Cross meet and the school hold assemblies and plays. Next to the{Sun Inn}is a {garage}and a village{shop and post {office.}There is a{sports field}behind Chestnut Springs but as yet no village football team to use it. A recent addition to{The Street}is an{antiques {shop}in the former village bakery.
